pr_title: Rework Sinks specs to put unsafe() at root level

timeline.message: polish formatting and naming of spec implementations

Rework specs to allow wrapping and put unsafe() at root level (#2418)

This commit reworks the Sinks specs so that the one() and empty() sinks
can have both a serialized and unsafe version.

Since  `unsafe()` lives at the ManySpec level, currently there's only
one set of `one()` and `empty()` factories.
So this commit introduces RootSpec and moves the `unsafe()` switch from
`ManySpec` to `Sinks` directly, retuning a `RootSpec` which allows
access to unsafe `one()` and `empty()`.

Internally, the implementation is also heavily simplified, collapsed
into only 2 internal classes for the specs.

avoid dangling classes, make them child classes of SinksSpecs

timeline.author: bsideup

replies.bodyText: because I consider this a good polish. having the internal classes under SinksSpecs rather than next to it prevent unnecessary IDE completion and confusion. unless you mean the Abstract prefix? we do rarely use it, indeed, but I feel SerializedSink is more ambiguous than SinksSpecs.AbstractSerializedSink...
replies.author: simonbasle

timeline.bodyText: maybe not "is serialized" but "is protected from non-serialized access"?
timeline.author: bsideup
